parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3
</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.06

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Set the texture of the given selection on all computers in a network session.<br>
Not all objects can be textured this way. See [[getObjectTextures]] for supported texture selections.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> All textures must have a resolution of 2^x / 2^y (e.g. 16x16, 16x32, 64x256, 512x32, etc). The largest texture size supported by the RV engine is 4096x4096.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> The effect is [[Multiplayer Scripting#Join In Progress|JIP]] compatible.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Do not put global commands in an object's init field : see [[Multiplayer Scripting#Join In Progress|Multiplayer Scripting - Join In Progress note]] for the explanation.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> If executed from a vehicle's init field (going against the above note), execution may happen too early and fail to broadcast over the network and to be [[Multiplayer Scripting#Join In Progress|JIP]] compatible.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> obj [[setObjectTextureGlobal]] [selection, texture]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> obj: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [selection,texture]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> selection: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> texture: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setObjectTextureGlobal]] [0, "\MyAddon\blue.paa"];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code><template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Set up a persistent texture keeper</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[addEventHandler]] ["Take", {
	([[getObjectTextures]] [[player]] + [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[uniformContainer]] [[player]] [[getVariable]] "texture"])
	[[params]] ["_texUniform", "_texInsignia", "_texCustom"];
	[[if]] ([[isNil]] "_texCustom") [[exitWith]] {};
	[[if]] (_texUniform == _texCustom) [[exitWith]] {};
	[[player]] [[setObjectTextureGlobal]] [0, _texCustom];
	[[false]]
}];


<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Example: make current uniform persistently blue</value></part></template>

[[private]] _texture = "#(rgb,8,8,3)color(0,0,1,1)"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>blue texture</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[setObjectTextureGlobal]] [0, _texture]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>set it on player</value></part></template>
[[uniformContainer]] [[player]] [[setVariable]] ["texture", _texture, [[true]]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>store it on uniform</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setObjectTexture]], [[getObjectTextures]], [[setObjectMaterial]], [[forceFlagTexture]]
</value></part></template>

<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Sometimes it could be necessary to set default material on an object for the texture to take effect:
<code>[[private]] _block = [[createVehicle]] ["Land_VR_Block_02_F", [[player]] [[getPos]] [20, [[getDir]] [[player]]], [], 0, "CAN_COLLIDE"];
_block [[setObjectMaterialGlobal]] [0, "\a3\data_f\default.rvmat"];
_block [[setObjectTextureGlobal]] [0, "#(rgb,8,8,3)color(1,0,0,1)"];</code>
Courtesy of '''[[User:Larrow|Larrow]]'''
</dd>
